column1: Cleft lip and palate are birth defects that affect the upper lip and the roof of the mouth.
Problems with genes passed down from 1 or both parents, drugs, viruses, or other toxins can all cause these birth defects.

A cleft lip and palate can: - Affect the appearance of the face - Lead to problems with feeding and speech - Lead to ear infections Babies are more likely to be born with a cleft lip and palate if they have a family history of these conditions or other birth defects.
A cleft lip may be just a small notch in the lip.
A physical examination of the mouth, nose, and palate confirms a cleft lip or cleft palate.
